discovery.text: His textbook on algebra was used in European universities for 500 years. He made math practical, not just theoretical.

twist.text: He also introduced Hindu-Arabic numerals to the Islamic world. Without him, you'd still be doing math in Roman numerals.

punchline.text: Every time you solve for x, you're following a 1,200-year-old lesson plan.

quiz.question: What was Al-Khwarizmi's major contribution to education?
options: He created algebra as a practical mathematical discipline
